title: Intel CEO Sees Turnaround Effort as Five-Year Job
sub_head: Restoring industry leadership, building contract chip-making business takes time, Pat Gelsinger says
body:
Intel Corp. Chief Executive Pat Gelsinger says his plan to turn around the U.S. semiconductor company is a multiyear assignment.
Mr. Gelsinger, who took over at Intel in February to try to fix operations after several years of missteps, has embarked on an effort to restore the companyâ€™s engineering prowess and build up a contract chip-making operation.
